meanings.definition: Gases that remain in a mine after an explosion, consisting mainly of carbon dioxide and nitrogen.
meanings.sent1: Miners must be cautious of afterdamps to stay safe underground.
meanings.sent2: The afterdamps in the mine posed a serious threat to the trapped workers.
meanings.sent3: The afterdamps played a dangerous hide-and-seek game in the dark tunnels.
meanings.sent4: The afterdamps hung in the air like a silent predator waiting to strike.
meanings.sent5: The afterdamps filled the mine with invisible danger, lurking around every corner.

meanings.definition: The toxic gases that linger in a mine after a fire or explosion.
meanings.sent1: Afterdamps can be deadly if inhaled by miners after an accident.
meanings.sent2: Rescue teams had to navigate through the afterdamps to reach the trapped miners.
meanings.sent3: The afterdamps whispered eerie warnings to those who dared to enter the mine.
meanings.sent4: The afterdamps clung to the walls like a sinister reminder of the disaster.
meanings.sent5: The afterdamps shrouded the mine in a veil of danger, unseen but ever-present.
